As checks for robustness of our regression specifications, we also run the baseline and expanded models by using projected wage rates from an extended Mincer regression model by including both sex ratios (the ratio of girls to boys in primary and secondary education) and infant mortality rates as additional instrument variables. The results are reported in Appendix Tables B4 and B5.  These results are consistent with the ones reported in the text.  As additional robustness tests, we have employed an alternative measure of average schooling attainments, based on Cohen and Soto (2007) in addition to the Barro and Lee measure in all regressions, and an alternative wage rate measure computed by OECD, in addition to our BLS measure, in our OECD-subsample regressions. All robustness tests produce similar findings.
